page.title: 16 LANGUAGE OF LITCHAM
page.content: The Norfolk dialect is an interesting one with many unusual alternatives to the Queen's perfect English.Phrases and nouns alike are changed.Although it's a wierd language most Norfolkers speak nomally with just an accent.People who have lived in Norfolk for about ten years will speak a reasonable Norfolk.Here are a few unusual words with meanings: Jasper(wasp),Troshen(working),Grup (hole) and 'omen(lady).There are several ways of saying that you've been told off or are going to be and that you,he or she is going to be angry.Here are some:Mum shouted me-Mum shouted at me,I'll square you up,I got wrong,I'll rare up at you.Although words like oh arr and bootiful appear ficticious on T.V. they are actually used in the Norfolk language.
